text:
Situation A. Ashley and Eli’s Claims

Examine each student’s claims. Who is correct? Explain.

Ashley’s Claim

The two outcomes for tossing a coin have the same chance of occurring on a toss. But the two outcomes for tossing a cup do not have the same chance of occurring.

Eli’s Claim

I think the two outcomes for each experiment have equal chances of occurring.

True, depending on the cup that is used.

Based on the class experimental results, students should see these results.

Depending on the cup that is used, this claim should be false.

All results are possible. But they are not equally likely.
